member.name: M:IV_Tessellator.IV_Tessellator.StandardAddInServer.CreateUCSByTransformationMatrix
member.summary: The object created does not represent a coordinate system but instead is a representation of the information that defines a coordinate system. You can use this object as input to the UserCoordinateSystems.Add method to create the actual coordinate system. The returned UserCoordinateSystemDefinition object returned is fully defined (initialized to an identity matrix) and can be used to create a coordinate system. However, you may want to change some of the values of the UserCoordinateSystemDefinition object before using it to create a coordinate system.
member.remarks: Copied from the Inventor 2012 COM API Reference file!

member.name: M:IV_Tessellator.IV_Tessellator.HyperbolicEngine.ComputeCircleParameters(Inventor.Point2d,Inventor.Point2d,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Compute the circle containing points a and b, and orthogonal to the unit circle (a.k.a shortest path between a and b in the hyperbolic sense). Return true if the output is a circle. False if the shortest path is a straight line (diameter of the unit circle).
